posts.post_content:
Anyone rating this sweet Beast down is clearly lacking in imagination. So many ways to break this card, it is a combo generator like nobody's business.  
  
[Roaring Primadox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Roaring Primadox) + [Shriekmaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shriekmaw) + [Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime) = remove any one permanent per round.

Anyone rating this sweet Beast down is clearly lacking in imagination. So many ways to break this card, it is a combo generator like nobody's business.

posts.post_content:
I'm really surprised that this card isn't rated at least 4 stars. Maybe it's not [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin), but it's quite awesome. In limited, it's practically a bomb. I run 3 of these in a fairly infuriating White & Green Combo Control deck. I love having a vast assortment of 'comes into play' creatures that can make my opponent's life miserable in a variety of different ways. I've found with that deck that my opponents often times just throw in the towel without even taking a single point of damage. It's my 'non-violent' control deck. I don't bother attacking and I tell my opponent "it isn't necesary". Also, I love playing this card, getting scoffed at, and then playing something like [Stonehorn Dignitary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonehorn Dignitary) the following turn and hearing "oooooooooooohhhhhhhh" in a timid voice.  
  
@hot4boys: If you call bouncing an [Elvish Visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Visionary) every upkeep and playing it back out for a free card every freaking turn "destroying your own boar... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: I used this in the prerelease to great effect, usually with a [bond beetle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bond beetle) or [elvish visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=elvish visionary) but once with a [thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thragtusk) (and it was glorious!) This is an efficient 4/4 with amazing combo potential with a number of cards in this set, let alone all of those in others. I wouldn't be surprised in the least to see this in a W/G flicker deck.
